Weaviate Academy Unit 1: Introduction. 
hey there good to see you again waviate is an open source Vector database but what does that mean exactly you might be familiar with traditional databases such as relational databases that use SQL our database can Catalog Store and retrieve information now a vector database can also carry out these tasks but with a key difference being that they can perform these tasks based on similarity imagine that you're searching for objects that matches a concept or an idea using SQL you might construct a query something like this and that would return all objects that match this query but in order to do this successfully you have to know all the possible terms that might have been used and then you still have to come up with some way of ranking the results of vector database on the other hand makes this job easier by enabling searches based on similarity so instead you could perform a query like this and it would return a list of entries that are ranked by their similarity to the query which was simply the central concept and what's more aviate indexes the data based on their similarity making this type of data retrieval lightning fast we think of databases as something that's used to Simply retrieve information however weviate takes static information and makes it dynamic what we're trying to say there is that webia can combined retrieval with the power of modern AI driven language models for example waviate can answer questions generate content and synthesize passages using retrieved information in this section you'll see examples of this and you might start to see how much these capabilities can change the way we interact with data thanks and we'll see you next time
